metadata.Title: CVE-2020-26541 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
The Linux kernel through 5.8.13 does not properly enforce the Secure BootForbidden Signature Database (aka dbx) protection mechanism. This affectscerts/blacklist.c and certs/system_keyring.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-26541` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-92-generic - 5.4.0-92.103~18.04.2
linux-image-5.4.0-92-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-92.103~18.04.2
linux-image-5.4.0-92-lowlatency - 5.4.0-92.103~18.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-92-generic - 5.4.0-92.103~18.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-92-lowlatency - 5.4.0-92.103~18.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1061-aws - 5.4.0-1061.64~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1065-azure - 5.4.0-1065.68~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1059-gcp - 5.4.0-1059.63~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1059-oracle - 5.4.0-1059.63~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1048-raspi - 5.4.0-1048.53~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1057-gke - 5.4.0-1057.60~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1029-gkeop - 5.4.0-1029.30~18.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1010-ibm - 5.4.0-1010.11~18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/bionic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4, was needed').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-92.103~18.04.2').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/bionic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-aws package in esm-infra/bionic is affected and needs fixing.
